newsitem.title: CHINA: Internet to be Microsoft's main business in China.
newsitem.headline: Internet to be Microsoft's main business in China.

text.p: Microsoft sees Internet-related products becoming its main source of revenue in China with the market for closed intranets growing particularly fast, Microsoft officials said on Tuesday.
But the officials said Microsoft was still in an investment phase in the China market and declined to estimate when the company would start to make money here.

"The Internet is our business in China," said Brad Chase, vice president in charge of Microsoft's Applications and Internet Client Group. "The Internet is not everything we do but it's a part of everything we do."

Chase later was due to sign a memorandum of understanding promoting Shanghai "Infoport" computer network development plans, aimed at linking up all government departments and major companies in the city.
He said China, which has been slow and cautious in its approach to the Internet due to doubts about its social and political implications, was now grasping the technologies eagerly.
"The Chinese government is now more encouraging on Internet access," he said. "They've improved."
